PUBLICATIONS AND LAW CASES (Boxes 110-119)(See boxes 118 and 119 for works by Bell)
Derrick Bell Published articles in Journals 1956-1993 (bound and un-bound)

-Change, Oct. 1979, "The Politics of Desegregation" -The Black Scholar, Vol 11, No. 1, Sept/Oct 1979, "Learning from the Brown Experience" -Emory Law Journal, Vol 28, No 4, Fall 1979, "Black Colleges & the Desegregation Dilemma" -California Law Review, Vol 67, No 1, Jan 1979, "Bakke, Minority Admissions, and the Usual Prince of Racial Remedies" - "Bakke, Minority Admissions, and the Usual Prince of Racial Remedies" from California Law Review, Vol 67, No 1, Jan 1979 -Harvard Civil Rights Civil Liberties Law Review, Vol 14, No 1, Spring 1979, "Introduction: Awakening After Bakke" -Legal Analysis, No. 3, Oct. 1979, "A Gift of Time" -Oregon Law Review, Vol 59, No 2 & 3, 1980 "Humanity in Legal Education" (paper 2, 1 Bound) - "Brown v. Board of Education & the Interest-Convergence Dilemma," from The Harvard Law Review, Jan 1980 (3)-Harvard Civil Rights Civil Liberties Law Review, Vol 16, No. 3, Winter 1982, Bell Reviews "Preferential Affirmative Action" by Daniel C. Maguire. (3 bound) -Phi Delta Kappan, April 1983, "Learning from our Loses: Is School Desegregation Still Feasible in the 1980s?" (1) -The 1983 James McCormick Mitchell Lecture, Bell Lecture "A Hurdle Too High: Class-based Roadblocks to Racial Remediation" from Buffalo Law Review 1984 -National Black Law Journal, Vol 10, No 3, 1988 Book Review of Bell's "And we are not Saved" (paper) -The Harvard Blackletter Journal, Spring 1989, "An Epistolary Exploration for a Thurgood Marshall Biography" (paper)
